thread.title: Man Utd news: Phil Neville explains why Luke Shaw is so 'disappointing' | Metro News
thread.title_full: Man Utd news: Phil Neville explains why Luke Shaw is so 'disappointing' | Metro News

author: Evan Bartlett For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Man Utd news: Phil Neville explains why Luke Shaw is so 'disappointing' | Metro News
text:
Evan Bartlett for Metro.co.uk Monday 27 Feb 2017 9:21 am Shaw’s last league appearance for United was in October (Getty Images) 
Just ask Iker Casillas and Juan Mata. Jose Mourinho has no time for reputation or ability. 
Application appears to be the only word the Portuguese manager cares about. 
This season, the player learning that lesson hardest is Luke Shaw. Jurgen Klopp sends warning to his Liverpool flops after Leicester loss 
The 21-year-old signed for Manchester United as one of the most highly-rated youngsters in England 18 months ago. 
But like Casillas at Madrid and Mata at Chelsea, Shaw looks set for a long period on the sidelines if he doesn’t adapt to meet Mourinho’s demands. Mkhitaryan has earned Jose Mourinho’s trust (Getty Images) 
Shaw is yet to earn Mourinho’s trust, according to Class of ’92 graduate Phil Neville, and he needs to apply himself more in order to gain it – just like Henrikh Mkhitaryan did earlier in the season. 
‘You have to train, behave and be a professional to a certain level for Mourinho,’ Neville told the Times . 
‘Luke’s obviously not doing it at a certain level consistently. The road to the EFL Cup final at Wembley Man Utd 
Round 3: Northampton (A) – 3-1 Round 4: Man City (H) – 1-0 Round 5: West Ham (H) – 4-1 SF 1: Hull City (H) – 2-0 SF 2: Hull City (A) – 1-2 Southampton 
Round 3: Crystal Palace (H) – 2-0 Round 4: Sunderland (H) – 1-0 Round 5: Arsenal (A) – 2-0 SF 1: Liverpool (H) – 1-0 SF 2: Liverpool (A) – 1-0 
‘José speaks well of Luke, says he’s got the ability. But Luke’s going through what Henrikh Mkhitaryan went through, somebody else José didn’t really trust. José couldn’t rely on Mkhitaryan in big games, to track runs, to play as part of the team.’ 
Neville agrees that Shaw has all the ability, but says his failure to nail down a starting place has been ‘disappointing’.
